intro: Sisymbrium acre, commonly known as field pennycress, is an annual flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is found in various regions across Europe and Asia. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. The plant's botanical features make it adaptable to a range of environmental conditions.
